entry.title: How to use Data Variants from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Test Automation Tool (TAT) in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
Context

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition solution comes with built-in test automation capabilities. Delivered with pre-scripted test processes and post-upgrade test coverage, the embedded Test Automation Tool (TAT) helps accelerate validation cycles and supports the creation of a robust regression test suite.

One particularly powerful, yet sometimes misunderstood, feature of the TAT is the Test Data Container (TDC).

This component allows project teams to define data variants, making it easier to test the same process across different business scenarios. In this blog, we will explore how to define and manage these variants, how automated test cases are synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM, and how the mapping between TAT and Cloud ALM test assets works, along with practical insights into what to expect.

 

Part 1: Understanding Test Data Containers (TDCs) and Data Variants in TAT

The Test Data Container (TDC) serves as a central repository for reusable test data, organized by functional area. It enables teams to manage a single source of test data for end-to-end test flows, which can be reused across multiple processes.

Data variants within the TDC can be defined manually or imported using Excel templates. Each variant represents a specific configuration of data inputs, for example, different company codes, plants, or customer IDs used to drive a specific execution of a test process.

 

Key Concepts

  • A Test Process represents a predefined business process, composed of one or more process steps.
  • A Test Plan in the TAT represents an end-to-end business flow, and may include several test processes.
  • Information can be passed from one process to another within a TAT Test Plan, supporting chaining and data reuse.
  • All test data required for the execution of a Test Plan can be maintained using TDCs and data variants.

Want to learn more? Two of my colleagues have written excellent deep-dives on this topic:
Test Data Container – Use Case
Test Data Container – Features Overview

Part 2: Synchronizing Automated Test Cases into SAP Cloud ALM

Once a Test Plan is created in TAT and assigned with its corresponding data variants, the next step is to synchronize it into SAP Cloud ALM using the Test Preparation app.

Here’s how to proceed:

  1. Click the Import button at the top right of the screen.
  2. Search for the Test Plans you created in TAT that you want to import.
  3. Select the desired Test Plans and click Import.
  4. Choose the appropriate Project Scope and Solution Process (if relevant)
  5. Click Save.

Important Notes:

  • If a Test Plan in TAT contains multiple data variants, each variant will be synchronized as a separate automated test case in SAP Cloud ALM.
    → For example, one Test Plan with 3 variants in TAT = 3 individual test cases in Cloud ALM.
  • In SAP Cloud ALM, the Test Case title is not the name of the Test Process from TAT, but rather the Test Plan name from TAT.
    The Variant field in SAP Cloud ALM is the key differentiator between the test cases derived from the same plan.

 

Part 3: Managing Test Plans in SAP Cloud ALM

Once test cases have been synchronized, you can group them into Test Plans within SAP Cloud ALM for structured execution and tracking.

Key Capabilities in CALM:

  • Combine manual and automated test cases in a single Test Plan
  • Assign test cases to individual testers
  • Track execution progress and report results centrally

For a detailed explanation of how to manage Test Plans in SAP Cloud ALM, I highly recommend this blog by my colleague Reiner: Advanced Test Orchestration and Tester Assignment

Clarification on Terminology

It’s important to note that the term "Test Plan" is used in both TAT and SAP Cloud ALM, but the meaning differs:

  • In TAT, a Test Plan defines how a business process is executed across multiple data variants.
  • In SAP Cloud ALM, a Test Plan is an organizational container for execution and reporting purposes.

There is no direct link between the Test Plans in both systems, they are conceptually and technically separate.

Conclusion

The integration between the S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool and SAP Cloud ALM offers a streamlined approach to managing test processes and data variants across the application lifecycle. By understanding the roles of Test Data Containers, how synchronization works, and the difference in test plan concepts between the two platforms, teams can better prepare for scalable and maintainable test automation.

Let me know in the comments if you’ve worked with data variants in TAT and how your team uses them within SAP Cloud ALM!

entry.title: Date Constraints in SAP Project and Resource Management
entry.content:
Meet Deadlines - Date Constraints in SAP Project and Resource Management 
SAP Project and Resource Management (SAP PRM) now allows you to define date constraints to ensure that critical project plan elements (work packages or milestones) start and finish on time. This reduces the likelihood of delays, facilitates the anticipation of bottlenecks, and enhances project scheduling capabilities. 
You can set 'Must Start On' and 'Must Finish On' constraints using the 'Manage Project Plans' app. In the Gantt Chart, constraints are displayed as small red triangles positioned on the top for Start Constraints and on the bottom for Finish Constraints. Milestones are limited to a Planned Finish date, which means they include the finish constraint but do not have a start constraint. 
When constraints are set and scheduling is initiated, any resulting conflicts—such as overlapping project plan elements—are shown as messages for the affected project plan elements, supporting easier access and quicker resolution.  
There are various methods to set or remove constraints, each tailored to specific purposes: 
 
There are various methods to set or remove constraints, each tailored to specific purposes: 
1. Detail Page 
2. Action Button 
3. Gantt Chart 
4. Table View 
5. Project Plan Service API 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Detail Page – Specify Constraints and include a corresponding Note (Reason) while maintaining a comprehensive overview of the selected project plan element:
 

2. Action Button - for setting or removing constraints on multiple project elements: 
Select the project elements you want to modify, then click the 'Action' Button to either add or remove constraints. If you opt for ‘Set Date Constraints’ on a work package, you'll automatically set the Planned Start and Planned Finish as 'Must Start On' and 'Must Finish On' constraints. For milestones, only the Planned Finish date will be set as the 'Must Finish On' constraint. 

3. Right-Click Menu on Gantt Chart – Provides enhanced individual control and quick access for adjustments within the Gantt view: 
Right-click on the relevant bar and select 'Set Date Constraints' or 'Remove Date Constraints' to choose whether to apply or remove the 'Must Start On' or 'Must Finish On' constraint. 
 

4. Table view – quick date entry by tabbing through constraint fields: 
Utilize the table settings to reveal the columns: ‘Start Date Constraint’ and ‘Finish Date Constraint’. Switching to the ‘Display Table’ view provides a clearer overview of the project plan in table format. 

5. Project Plan Service API - to modify constraint settings:  
For detailed information, refer to the Business Accelerator Hub.

entry.title: Supply Chain Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release is here and delivers a broad range of innovations and enhancements across core business processes, focusing on greater automation, improved user experience, and deeper integration to help organizations run more efficiently in a cloud-first environment. Don't miss the highlights blog by Bert Schulze to find out more about the top innovations across the cloud ERP, or find out about the top AI & next-gen ERP features in this post by Yannick Peterschmitt.

With the supply chain specialists and logistics maestros in mind - this blog post dials in on the latest supply chain management features being rolled out in and around the 2508 release. With this release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, supply chain management takes another step forward in agility, intelligence, and integration. This update introduces a range of enhancements designed to optimize end-to-end processes, improve real-time visibility, and support faster decision-making across logistics and operations. Whether you're focused on inventory, transport, production, or delivery, the 2508 release brings innovative features that align with today's demand for resilient and sustainable supply chains. Check out the release video below for the quick summary of selected features, or read on below for more detail and some comprehensive E2E demos!

 

Core Logistics Topics

We'll kick things off with the latest core logistics features release in 2508, designed to enhance your fundamental supply chain execution and planning processes.


Inventory Management
Support for Copied Movement Types in SAP Fiori Apps for Goods movement

Flexibility to adapt business processes is a vital aspect of a dynamic supply chain, and custom movement types in SAP S/4HANA Cloud offer just that. These custom adaptations of standard movement types serve to bridge gaps where predefined scenarios may not meet particular business needs, allowing tailor-made solutions for unique business requirements. The SAP FIORI apps which support custom movement types have been extended to include Manage stock (F1062), Transfer Stock – In Plant (F1061) and Transfer Stock – Cross Plan (F1957).

One prominent use case for custom movement types arises when there’s a need to post goods movements to different General Ledger (GL) account determinations. While standard movement types seamlessly integrate with key SAP FIORI apps for goods movement, setting up a custom movement type involves a simple two-step process: first, copy an existing standard movement type in your configuration environment, assigning it a new character key starting with 9, x, y, or z, while adding any additional necessary details. The next step is to implement the custom Business Add-In (BAdI) MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA. This facilitates the availability of this newly created movement type alongside standard options in the supported FIORI apps, allowing users the flexibility to select the movement type that best fits their operational needs. This approach not only maximizes the system’s adaptability but also ensures streamlined and efficient management of specialized business processes.

For a step-by-step description of the implementing this process, check out this blog post.


(fig: Custom movement types displayed in Transfer Stock – In Plant)

New FIORI App - Manage Physical Inventory Document Items

In Inventory Management, a key theme of the 2508 release is the strategic modernization of the user experience to boost performance and analytical capabilities. With the 2508 release, we introduce the new app “Manage Physical Inventory document Items” (F8634) as a successor to transaction MI20 “Process physical inventory count results”, which has been deprecated. The experience switch is enabled on both apps, enabling users with the correct authorizations to switch between them with ease. The new app provides a clearer overview of physical inventory tasks, directly in the list view saving users time. The new app’s functionality doesn’t stop there; it empowers you to fine-tune your workflow through customization options. For instance, adding fields such as storage bin information can streamline precise material location management. Moreover, with enhanced filtering capabilities, you can now delve deeper into your data, allowing for a more nuanced analysis of inventory differences. With these improvements, transitioning to the Manage Physical Inventory Item List (F8634) app not only future-proofs your inventory operations but also enriches the way you interact with your inventory data.

Support for Barcode Scanning for Additional Goods Issues (Project / Asset)

A further new feature in inventory management – the "Manage Stock" app has been enhanced with barcode scanning for goods movements for both project stock and assets. New movement types for this stock have been introduced to streamline and optimize your inventory management processes. Efficiency gains come with the capability to leverage composite barcode scanning within the app. Users can select the new stock change options for goods issue projects or assets in the manage stock app, then assign the related WBS element or asset or sub-asset number respectively. This enhancement translates to faster and more efficient processing of inventory adjustments, reducing not just the margin for error but also the time spent managing inventory tasks. Overall, these updates are set to greatly enhance stock management workflows, making them not only more efficient but also more aligned with contemporary business needs.

Cross-Plant Transfer Posting with Item Lines

Item lists are a collection of material items that you can process together in warehouse or inventory processes. Whilst this is a familiar feature, with 2508 we have expanded where item lists are deployed to enhance inventory processes and introduce them to the “Transfer Stock – Cross Plan” application. Here, it is now possible to create a list of multiple items for stock transfer, enabling users to post items in one step and on one material document. This provides greater visibility as you see all transferred items in one list across plants and improves efficiency when checking movement history for several materials on one list.

Extensibility Updates

Enhancing process flexibility, this release introduces new extensibility options for material reservation applications. Businesses can now add custom fields to the user interfaces and underlying business logic for creating, changing, and displaying reservations. This allows companies to capture and process specific information relevant to their unique operational needs directly within the reservation document. For example, a business could add a field to track a project code or a specific reason for the reservation, improving data richness, enhancing reporting, and ensuring that custom process requirements are met without complex workarounds.

Handling Unit Management

Key to managing packaging, tracking and handling goods throughout your supply chain, we also have some updates to Handling Unit Management functionality. With this release, we introduce two key enhancements to Handling Units APIs.

Assign Serial Numbers to Existing Handling Units

A key innovation in this release is the enhancement of the Handling Unit (HU) OData API, which now supports the assignment of serial numbers to already created handling units—a critical capability that was previously missing. This enhancement addresses a functional gap left by previous API operations that only supported packing and posting goods receipt for production orders. Now, before a goods receipt is posted, serial numbers can be assigned to HUs via the API, streamlining processes where HUs are prepared in advance. This capability ensures better alignment with manufacturing and warehouse workflows where serialization is required before physical goods receipt.

The updated API enables serial number assignment through two supported scenarios: either by generating serial numbers automatically at production order creation (based on the serial number profile), or by receiving them from an external system via API communication. The API intelligently checks whether a production order already includes serial numbers and defaults to these when assigning to HUs, ensuring data consistency. This innovation not only supports developer extensibility and integration flexibility but also significantly enhances traceability and compliance in serialized environments—especially in regulated industries.

Enhanced Security for Production Supply Area Data

To strengthen integration security, the Production Supply Area (PSA) OData API now supports OAuth 2.0 authentication, aligning with modern SAP security protocols and standards. This enhancement ensures a more secure, token-based authorization process, enabling third-party applications to access SAP S/4HANA Cloud resources without exposing sensitive credentials in the payload. OAuth 2.0 improves trust and compliance for integrations, especially in multi-system landscapes where security and granular access control are critical.

This update also improves connectivity with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), making it easier to securely link external applications to SAP S/4HANA Cloud for PSA-related data access. Applications can now request specific scopes of access to user data, supporting role-based security and limiting unnecessary data exposure. With this change, customers gain more controlled, secure, and scalable integration patterns for managing production supply data across platforms.


Delivery Management

RAP events are standardized notifications that signal changes in business objects, enabling flexible and loosely coupled extensions in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. With the latest innovation, RAP events are now available for outbound delivery, inbound delivery, and customer returns delivery, empowering developers working with embedded extensibility (Developer Extensibility) to enhance their projects directly on-stack. You can implement custom logic to consume events such as Created, Changed, or Deleted for these delivery documents, as well as more granular events like Picking Status Changed or Item Created for outbound deliveries. This makes it possible to react instantly to delivery-related changes in your extensions built with the ABAP environment, while leveraging standardized events that increase development efficiency and consistency across solutions


Order Promising

Conversational Backorder Processing with Joule (Beta)

Imagine running a complex backorder processing (BOP) run by simply having a conversation. With the 2508 release, this is now a reality! Introduced initially as a BETA feature, from CFD release 2508.2, all users with a base license of Joule can leverage AI to automate BOP checks and processing.

Using simple, natural language commands in a chat, you can check stock situations and initiate a BOP run. For example, you can tell Joule you want to run BOP for a specific product and plant. In the background, Joule will prompt for which strategy you wish to implement with the default selection of “improve”, it creates the necessary BOP segment and variant, and processes the run—skipping multiple manual steps and app-toggling. This is a fantastic leap forward in simplifying a powerful process, and we are excited to hear how adopting this feature has enhanced your experience!

 

 

Display Product Availability Enhancements

With the 2508 release, we bid farewell to jumping between various transactions when seeking a comprehensive overview of product availability. The new Display Product Availability Fiori app is here to modernize and simplify your experience. Instead of scattered views, you now get all relevant availability information in a single, intuitive three-panel layout. At a glance, you see a high-level summary of available quantities, a detailed drill-down of MRP elements such as stocks and requirements, and a clear "Scope of Check" panel showing which supply and demand elements are included. With this release, the app now also includes the Analyze Product Availability feature. This allows you to dive deeper into product availability at the plant level. You can easily analyze product availability by selecting the plant you want to review and the app gives you a clear overview of confirmations, showing why certain quantities are available on specific dates and how concurrent demands impact stock or receipts. This makes it easier to respond to customer needs and share insights with stakeholders.

To dig deeper, you can drill down on MRP elements, adjust the date range to see planned changes, or view the scope of check to understand exactly which stocks, receipts, and requirements are considered. Horizon settings further explain why available quantities may appear positive, zero, or even negative. By surfacing these factors in one place, the app provides transparency and confidence in managing product availability.

See the new enhancements in the below demo video:

 

What’s more, with CFD release 2508.1, we extend these MRP features beyond the plant category to also account for storage locations. Conduct analysis and drill down on the same elements based on storage location with the same simplified UI panels within the Display Product Availability app.

Activating ATP Check for Subcontracting Outbound Delivery Creation

Many customers working with the subcontracting purchasing process face a key challenge: preventing outbound delivery notes from being created when there is no stock available. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud release 2508, we address this challenge by enabling ATP checks for subcontracting outbound delivery creation. Until now, the ATP (Available-to-Promise) check was not triggered for subcontracting deliveries, meaning delivery notes could still be generated even if stock levels are zero.

This gap can create inefficiencies, as users may be instructed to pick items that simply aren’t available in the warehouse. For companies which outsource parts of their manufacturing through subcontractors, accurate stock management is essential to keep production flowing. It is critical that only available and ready-to-pick stock is passed into subcontracting deliveries. Without validation, discrepancies between SAP and the actual warehouse stock can lead to delays, wasted effort, and disruptions in the supply chain.

By enabling configuration of the ATP check flag in the 2508 release, ATP  check can be enforced for subcontracting deliveries, ensuring that stock availability is validated before outbound deliveries are created. The result is clear: consistent order promising across the supply chain, improved accuracy, and smoother end-to-end operations.

 

Transportation Management

Stock transfer with delivery (BME) with warehouse management and transportation management(outbound)

One of the key challenges for supply chain specialists is managing outbound processes efficiently while ensuring seamless coordination between warehouse and transportation operations. Expanding on the outbound process defined in scope item “stock transfer with delivery (BME)”, with the 2502.3 release, we integrate both warehouse management and transportation management to streamline stock transfer orders end to end.

Customers can now create intra-company Stock Transport Orders (STOs) that automatically trigger Freight Unit (FU) creation in TM and generate Outbound Deliveries, which are processed through WM for picking, packing, and loading. A key new feature is dynamic delivery splitting—if not all handling units (HUs) can be loaded, the system automatically creates a new outbound delivery for the remaining goods. Additionally, TM now supports stock transfers from WM-managed locations, and includes batch-managed material data in freight documents. These updates provide customers with a fully integrated, automated logistics flow that improves supply chain visibility, operational efficiency, and flexibility—especially in dynamic warehouse and transport environments.

 

Enabling key user extensibility of freight document user interfaces

This feature introduces the flexibility to adapt the user interface of applications based on Web Dynpro ABAP (WDA)and Floorplan Manager (FPM), giving your business greater control over how classic application screens look and function. It addresses the common challenge of rigid UIs by empowering key users and technical teams to configure freight document interfaces—such as adding or removing fields, adjusting layouts, or rearranging elements—to match specific business needs. The feature allows you to adjust the structure of main UI pages, including the sequence and titles of tabs, as well as tailor the content of specific areas—for example, changing the order of fields, updating field labels, or hiding elements that aren’t relevant. With this update, we’re delivering clear value in supporting the customizing of UIs which better reflect your company’s specific use cases and processes, enabling users to interact with the applications more productively.

 

Warehouse Management

Keeping up with the Suite-First strategy, in 2508 much has been done to ensure that Warehouse Management functionality supports all scope items and process variations available within SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP. Take a look in more detail in this blog by Christian Ries. Below, we’ll focus on a few new features we want to highlight in particular.

Stock Removal Strategy for direct goods movement postings (EWM)

A much requested feature which we’re happy to roll out to customers, the Post Goods Movement app now includes a new button that triggers the stock removal strategy. This automatically determines the optimal storage bin, handling unit, and batch or serial number when posting a direct goods issue. Available for goods issue postings in manufacturing orders and reservations, this feature streamlines the process by aligning with your stock removal strategy to select the best storage bin. The result is greater efficiency and accuracy when posting goods issues, reducing manual effort and errors. Specifically designed for goods issue of production components, this enhancement ensures that the right stock is used at the right time—supporting faster, more reliable production execution.

Summarized JIT Calls 

This feature enables efficient handling of outbound deliveries that reference summarized Just-in-Time (JIT) calls within Warehouse Management. By integrating seamlessly with JIT processes, it ensures that deliveries comply with configured underdelivery and overdelivery tolerances. Leveraging the built-in warehouse management capabilities—such as picking, packing, staging, and loading—you can now handle outbound processing of summarized JIT calls (scope item 2EM) more effectively. Outbound deliveries with JIT references can be easily selected and processed within warehouse management, improving efficiency, accuracy, and reliability, while directly benefiting customers through more consistent and timely deliveries.

 

Integrating Extended Warehouse Management


Many of our customers have sophisticated supply chains and warehouse processes which involve central hubs and different satellite entities. With 2508, we are excited to roll out an integration scenario which will make managing such a set up much simpler. With the new communication scenario, Logistics - S/4HANA Extended Warehouse Management Integration (SAP_COM_0A58), you can now integrate a decentralized Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) system in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition with your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This integration provides essential services to distribute and maintain inbound and outbound deliveries across hybrid landscapes. This helps your organization leverage existing EWM investments while expanding your cloud footprint, ensuring seamless data flow for critical delivery processes.

In-house Repair with Warehouse Management

A common challenge in after-sales service is managing the logistics of returning repaired products back to customers quickly and efficiently. With the 2508 release, we have enhanced the in-house repair process (scope item 3XK) by integrating warehouse management. This should streamline this process enabling companies to more efficiently define and execute their in-house repair workflows.

The process begins when a returned product is received and logged into the warehouse, where serial numbers are verified and the item is moved to a clarification zone for inspection. If an in-house repair is needed, a follow-up activity is created, ensuring the right material and serial number are tracked through the repair cycle. Once the product is fixed, an outbound delivery order is generated, and warehouse management takes over again to pick, pack, stage, and load the item for shipment back to the customer.



By leveraging warehouse management capabilities, organizations can optimize every step of the return—from picking and packing the repaired product to staging and loading it for shipment. This ensures accuracy, reduces manual effort, and speeds up turnaround times, ultimately improving the customer experience while driving efficiency in logistics operations. The 2508 release highlights in the supply chain management area of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition should help optimize your supply chain and logistics processes. entry.title: Sales Order: Automatically Derive Functional Area via Revenue Projects
entry.content:
When creating a Sales Order, there are different ways to automatically derive a functional area. However, if functional areas are not maintained in G/L accounts and profit centers are not used with indirect derivation via cost centers, another option is available: Revenue Projects. In their master data, a functional area can be maintained, which is then automatically adopted during sales order creation.
Step-by-Step Guide: Deriving the Functional Area from a Revenue Project

  1. Ensure that no functional area is maintained in the G/L account.
  2. Verify that the Revenue Project has a functional area assigned and that the project status is set to Released.
  3. Create a Sales Order using the corresponding Revenue Project.

     


  4. Generate the invoice from the Sales Order.
  5. Review which functional area was used during posting and identify the object from which it was derived.

As demonstrated, the functional area is successfully derived from the Revenue Project during posting when G/L accounts have no functional areas, profit centers are not used, and the accounts are intentionally kept functional-area free. This approach ensures reliable automatic derivation without requiring any changes to the existing system logic.

entry.title: ABAP AI Revolution Accelerates: The ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps in Minutes
entry.content:
The ABAP AI revolution just got a massive functionality upgrade and stays FREE OF CHARGE for another year

entry.title: BKP - Customer Returns Project Solution for Advanced Intercompany Sales
entry.content:
Context

Since year 2022, advanced intercompany sales (Single Level / Single System), using scope item 5D2, is available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. It is a better solution compared with the classical intercompany sales solution.

Advanced Intercompany Sales - Single Level / Single System

For more details, read the blog:

Advanced Intercompany Sales & Stock Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Below is an example of the solution process flow for 5D2 in value chain monitor, starting with sales order 17729.

Nowadays, there is no standard, corresponding customer returns solution for advanced intercompany sales.

In your project, you will need to identify an appropriate customer returns solution for advanced intercompany sales (5D2).

In this blog, several project solutions are proposed for managing returns of advanced intercompany sales, you can select the most suitable one based on your business needs.

 

Solution Option 1: 2F4 Classical intercompany returns  

In general, the classical intercompany returns process is a simplified, out of box solution.

Classic Intercompany Returns - Single Level / Single System

Below is the classical intercompany returns solution process flow with reference to sales order 17729. This is available in returns overview at item level in manage customer returns version 2 App.

Step by step guidelines are available in scope item 2F4 .

 The Solution option 1 includes the following highlights:

  • For selling company and delivering company – there is no need for an explicit customer/supplier relationship.
  • Returned Product is physically shipped back to delivering company’s plant directly.

However, there are some special restriction or limitation to consider with this option

  • Important: Technically, if you have activated scope item 5W2 (Group Valuation), the system will not allow you to activate classic intercompany processes - including this scope item 2F4.  Check more in KBA 3093830 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Release Restriction Note for Group Valuation. 
  • As this is the classical solution, the new concept or innovation in 5D2 are not available in 2F4.
    • No returns purchase order, and no supplier credit memo in selling company, and no intercompany returns order in delivering company.
    • No transit plant concept in selling company in such classical intercompany returns.
  • Additionally, the classical intercompany returns, whether used for classical intercompany sales or advance intercompany sales, have specific by-design features and limitations:
    • During goods receipt, returned product is automatically valuated in receiving company and the sales cost is reversed. This is by design.
    • If there is a material inspection split for returns delivery item, intercompany credit memo process is not supported at this time.

 

Solution Option 2: BKP Customer Returns - Using Logistical Follow-Up Activity (LFU) 0007 – Directly ship to supplier

In general, the option 2 is a customized and simplified solution.

In this solution option, basically, for intercompany returns end to end process, we split the returns process for selling companying and delivering company. Each company runs BKP (customer returns) separately. We utilize the predefined logistical follow-up activity (LFU) 0007 “directly ship to supplier” in the selling company.  This solution option has the following highlights:

  • We establish an internal customer (selling company) and internal supplier (delivering company) relationship - Treating delivering company as the supplier for selling company. 
  • Like outbound shipment from delivering plant in sales process, in this return’s scenario, product is returned to delivering plant (delivering company) directly.
  • Enhanced document flow - returns purchase order and supplier credit memo in selling company, and intercompany returns order in delivering company are created.
  • Inventory, sales cost and revenue can be reversed with regular finance accounting in the two companies.

Selling company handles the returns from the end customer as follows:

  1. Create a returns order with reference, using logistical follow-up activity 0007 “direct ship to supplier”. Use the business partner (BP) of the delivery company code as supplier, not the delivery plant. Select the right return-to address from the supplier. Change the plant to the plant of selling company, instead of the copied intercompany plant.
  2. No returns delivery to the selling company – the customer sends the goods to delivery company directly.
  3. A returns purchase order for the delivering company is created following step 1.
  4. Receive a credit memo from the delivering company and perform supplier credit memo verification.
  5. Determine refund for the end customer with credit memo request and credit memo.

Delivering company handles (internal) customer returns from selling company as follows:

  1. Create a returns order to handle (intercompany) customer returns from the selling company.
  2. The returns delivery is created, and post goods receipt once the end customer ships back the product.
  3. Perform product inspection and decide the final logistical follow-up as usual.
  4. Determine the refund for the internal customer – selling company with credit memo request and credit memo.

There are some special restrictions or takeaways to consider for this option

  • Returns order creation in the selling company
    • Intercompany plant can’t be used if it is copied from sales order. Use the plant belonging to the selling company. Transit plant designed in 5D2 might be used.
    • Use the BP of delivery company code as the supplier. The BP of the delivering plant is currently not supported. Ensure you select the right return-to address based on the supplier.
  • Returns Purchase Order (RPO) in the selling company
    • It would be automatically created with LFU 0007. RPO might encounter the account assignment category issue as it is created with reference to the purchase order (PO) from sales process. Today, expert configuration can be considered for RPO creation without reference.
  • Supplier Credit Memo in the selling company
    • Manual creation is required. With B2B/EDI between the selling company and delivering company, automation is possible.
  • Intercompany returns order in the delivering company
    • It can only be created without reference.
    • Use the BP of selling company as the sold-to party.
  • Other processes in delivering company are performed as usual, such as the product by default not being valuated during goods receipt.

 

Solution Option 3: BKP Customer Returns - Using Logistical Follow-Up Activity 0005 – Ship to supplier

In general, option 3 is a customized solution, and you can adopt it if it matches your real returns process.

In this solution option, basically, for the intercompany returns end-to-end process, we split the returns process for the selling companying and delivering company. Each company run BKP (customer returns) separately. We utilize the predefined logistical follow-up activity 0005 “ship to supplier” in the selling company. his solution option has the following highlights:

  • We establish an internal customer (selling company) and internal supplier (delivering company) relationship - Treating delivering company as the supplier for selling company. 
  • in this return’s scenario, the product is returned to the selling company plant first and then returned to the delivering plant (delivering company) as 2nd step.
  • Enhanced document flow – a returns purchase order and supplier credit memo in the selling company, and intercompany returns order in delivering company are created.
  • Inventory, sales cost and revenue can be reversed with regular finance accounting in the two companies.

Selling company handles returns from the end customer as follows

  1. Create a returns order, using logistical follow-up activity (LFU) 0001- receive into plant. Use the plant of the selling company.  
  2. Returns delivery is auto created, and post goods receipt once you receive the returned product from the customer. 
  3. Perform material inspection, using LFU 0005 – ship to supplier – treating delivery company as the supplier (here use the BP number of delivery company code as supplier).
  4. Returns purchase order is created in above step 3. Perform the outbound delivery to ship the returned product to delivery company.
  5. Receive the intercompany credit memo from the delivery company and perform credit memo verification.
  6. Determine the refund for the end customer with credit memo request and credit memo.

Delivering company handles intercompany customer returns from selling company as follows

  1. Create a returns order to handle the intercompany customer returns from the selling company.
  2. Returns delivery is created post goods receipt when you receive the returned product from the selling company.
  3. Perform product inspection and decide the final logistical follow-up activity.
  4. Determine the refund for the internal customer – selling company with credit memo request and credit memo.

There are some special restrictions or takeaway to consider for this option

  • Returns order creation in selling company
    • Intercompany plant can’t be used if it is copied from sales order. Use the plant belonging to the selling company for the physical receiving of the returned product.
  • Material Inspection in selling company
    • Use logistical follow up activity 0005 “ship to supplier” to forward the returned product to the delivery company. Use the BP of the delivery company code as the supplier. BP of the delivering plant is currently not supported.  RPO might encounter the account assignment category issue as it is created with reference to the PO from the sales process. Today, expert configuration can be considered for RPO creation without reference.
  • Supplier Credit Memo in selling company
    • Manual creation is required. With B2B/EDI between the selling company and delivering company, automation is possible.
  • Intercompany returns order in delivering company
    • It can only be created without reference.
    • Use BP of selling company as the sold -to party.
  • Other processes in delivering company are performed as usual, such as product by default not being evaluated during goods receipt.

 

Master Data Set Up for Option 2 and 3

For Solution Option 2 and Option 3, there are below tips to highlight

  • Use the BP of delivery company code as the supplier. Do not use the BP of the delivering plant.
  • For supplier master data
    • Ensure the returns supplier is selected. With selection, you must assign a customer (same partner with customer role) to deal with the outbound shipping for returns purchase order.

 

  • You might maintain the right return–to address for the supplier if option 2 is used.  Check the help document Return-to Address Determination for Supplier Returns
  •  Ensure you have the right info record maintained for the returns purchase order.

 

Summary

3 solution options in project for intercompany returns to deal with advanced intercompany sales are recommended.

You can adopt the suitable one in your project, considering the restrictions and takeaways in each solution.

entry.title: Batch Split Valuation in Product Cost Controlling and Margin Analysis
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog will illustrate how Cloud ERP standard features and scope items can handle customer’s product profitability reporting requirements based on product batches. Product cost controlling aspect of split valuation will be our focus and specifically, below scope items are relevant for the blog:

  • Event-Based Production Cost Posting(3F0)
  • Actual costing (33Q)
  • Margin Analysis (J55)

Business requirements

The customer would like to view profitability based on a specific product batch. The revenue for the product is the same cross batches, but the costs may vary for different batches. From management accounting point of view, the “cost objects” here is the combination of products and their batches.

 

Meeting the requirements

SAP Cloud ERP standard features can handle such business requirements. Split valuation based on batches needs to be activated( please refer to blog Split Valuation in Inventory Management on SAP S/4... - SAP Community and its references for more details about split valuation).

With the support of batch split valuation in production accounting (please refer to Split Valuation - Production Scenarios - Product Cost by Order - Production Accounting) Production variances can be posted to the product batches upon goods receipt from the manufacturing orders.

Let’s demonstrate the processes  with some testing screenshots.

Here, two production orders are created and upon goods receipts, production variances are settled. 

Variances with different categories (SLA Line-Item types) are posted to EO Profitability Segment with Inventory Valuation Type attribute. (only one production order is shown in the screenshots)

Next, two sales orders are created for the same product with plans on delivering two different batches (Inventory Valuation Types) respectively.

With delivery orders created based on the sales orders, post goods issues are performed based on product batches. Here, in the accounting document, the cost of goods sold is with Inventory Valuation Type filled (only one sales order process is shown in the screenshots)

Afterwards, with billing performed, revenue is posted with the product batch as additional dimension.

In Trial Balance app, the profitability can be seen for the product and inventory valuation types, albeit the costs of goods sold at this stage are based on standard costs and they are the same for both valuation types. (Alternatively, other Fiori apps can also be used such as Sales Orders - Actuals, Market Segments – Actuals, Product Profitability with Production Variances if the Inventory Valuation Type field is enabled through Data Source Extensions)

During period end, the actual costing run process  will distribute variances proportionally among inventory, work in process, and consumption with the granularity of valuation types and materials. As can be seen, valuation type is available in Material Price Analysis, therefore the “cost object” here is the combination of material and valuation type(batch) and they have different actual prices.

s

(Thanks to @GraceZou  for doing the testing for this part and please refer to her blog Actual Costing in SAP Cloud ERP - SAP Community for Actual Costing business processes)

The previous posted costs of goods sold for the batches(Inventory Valuation Type) will get revaluated to reflect the actual costs for the batches. Together with posted revenues, the profitabilities for the product batches can be arrived at.

From margin analysis side, Inventory Valuation Type will be available in Product Profitability Review Booklet In the upcoming release.

Summary

This blog omits split valuation master data set-up, production planning, sales and distribution aspect of process and screenshots, rather, it focuses on Inventory Valuation Type on accounting documents for the business processes with regards to production accounting, actual costing settlement and revaluation, and profitability reports.

Feel free to leave comments or post questions and explore other content and blogs in the community.

entry.content:
Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The extensibility expert right next to you

Have you ever been in a situation

  • where you had to create or maintain a key user custom field or create some key user custom logic but wondered which business context, which OData service, which SOAP service, or in general which object you must extend out of the thousands of potential candidates?
  • or where you must figure out which CDS view you should choose as value help provider for your key user custom field out of the thousands of options?
  • or where you know the UI or API service to which you need to add an extension field, but you have no idea which business context or data source needs to be extended?

If your answer is yes, then this blog post is just for you. In this blog, you’ll meet the GenAI-driven Extensibility Assistant, which helps you to master such challenges. Starting with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, the extensibility assistant is available in the Custom Fields Fiori app and in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

You’ll learn how to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user and how to use it.

How to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user

The extensibility assistant belongs to the feature set of Joule for Developers (J4D) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The first step you need to take to make the extensibility assistant available in a system is to “activate” J4D for the system. How this can be done is described in SAP Note 3571857. You can find more information regarding J4D in general (also regarding the licensing) here: https://www.sap.com/documents/2025/02/b4f714de-f57e-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html

Please note that the GenAI-driven extensibility assistant is only available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and only in systems where development is supported:

  • In 3-system landscapes, this is the development system

Once J4D is activated for your system, you need to assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to your user. Please note that you need to use client 100, as the key user extensibility apps are only available there.

You can assign the business catalog in various ways:

  1. copy the extensibility template business role SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC to your own role and assign this copied role to your user. You can refer to Maintain Business Roles for further details on how to maintain business roles
  2. assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to another custom business role that you assign to your user

As soon as the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC is assigned to your user, the button “Open Assistant” will be active in the Custom Logic and the Custom Fields Fiori app (see screenshots below).

Open Assistant button in Custom Fields and Custom Logic Fiori app

If it turns out that though you followed all the steps described above  still the "Open Assistant" button does not occur please create a customer ticket on application component BC-SRV-APS-EXT-FLD.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app.

When you click “Open Assistant” in the Custom Fields Fiori app, the extensibility assistant pops up (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

You can now enter your question or your request in the text box located under the “Your Question” label.

You’ll notice a question mark icon next to the “Your Question” label. Clicking the question mark, a popup appears explaining you how to interact with the extensibility assistant, providing you recommendations when it comes to how to formulate your questions, and showing you a set of example questions (see screenshot below):

Explanation popup of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

To understand in detail how to interact with the extensibility assistant, let’s have a look at a concrete example. Let’s assume that you were told to create a custom field which should capture an UPS tracking number of parcels belonging to specific sales orders. The field should be included in the OData API for Customer Return documents, as this information is essential for communication with another company.
In general, let’s say that you know the Custom Fields Fiori app, and you know how to create a custom field (by pressing the + button on the upper left corner of the Custom Fields app).
What you’ll most likely not know is which business context you have to choose out of the more than 500 available ones. You most likely also won’t know the exact name of the OData API in which you should enable the field.

That is where the extensibility assistant comes in handy. The scenario mentioned above usually consists of the following steps:

1. You enter your question or your request into the question text box. In this case, the text we enter is “Create a field UPSTrackingNumber and enable it for the customer return OData API”. As soon as you’ve entered the text and pressed the return button (or clicked on the arrow button on the right), the assistant’s answer is shown in the “Assistant Response” text box. It might be for example “I found multiple business contexts related to "customer return". Please choose one of the following options:”. Please note that on the lower right corner of the “Assistant Response” text box, there is a link to “References”. Opening the link, you’ll get a list of SAP documentation links like Fiori Apps Library links, Business Accelerator Hub links, and others which have been the knowledge source of the assistant’s answer. You can click on these links to navigate to these documents. Within the “Assistant Proposal” box, there are business contexts shown which are relevant to the context of your question. You can simply choose one of them by pressing the select button on the right side of the respective option (see screenshot below).

Select business context

In our case, the UPSTrackingNumber field belongs to the header of the Sales Order document. We’ll choose the business context SD_SALESDOC with the description “Sales: Sales Document”.
Note that the extensibility assistant shows a relevance score telling you how relevant the finding is in the context of your question.

2.As soon as you’ve selected the respective business context, the extensibility assistant responds for example “I found multiple OData APIs related to customer return. Please choose one of the following options to enable the custom field:”. You’ll see a list of OData API options from which you can choose. Please note that in this case, a column “Documentation” is shown which allows you to navigate directly to the documentation of the respective OData API to validate whether this is really the API you were looking for (see screenshot below).

Select OData API
In this case, you select the second-best option, as you prefer to use an OData V2 service and not its OData V4 variant.

3. As soon as you’ve selected the OData API option, the extensibility assistant responds for example “The custom field UPSTrackingNumber has been prepared for enabling in the OData API Customer Return (A2X) - V2 (API_CUSTOMER_RETURN_SRV~1). Please make sure to save the changes to make them permanent. If you need any further assistance, feel free to ask!” and proposes an action which you can see in the “Proposed Action” box on the bottom of the extensibility assistant pop-up (see screenshot below).

Proposed Create custom field action

You can now check whether the proposal of the assistant fits your needs and if so, you can simply click “Accept” on the lower right side of the “Proposed Action” box. With that, the data is handed over to the “Create Field” screen of the Custom Fields app (see screenshot below).

Proposal taken over from the extensibility assistant to the “New Field” popup

You can check the data once again and change it if needed. There is always a human in-between, and the extensibility assistant never does something on its own within the system.

Please note that instead of clicking “Accept”, you can continue to chat with the extensibility assistant as it remembers the conversation history. You can, for example, ask the extensibility assistant “Why did you choose a length of 50 for this field” and in the “Assistant Response” the assistant will answer for example “The length of 50 for the custom field UPSTrackingNumber was chosen as a reasonable default to accommodate typical tracking numbers, which can vary in length depending on the carrier and format. If you have specific requirements or need a different length, please let me know, and I can adjust it accordingly!”.
You can also ask the assistant to enable the field in further usages like APIs or SOAP services, or any other available location.

Now, we’ve used the extensibility assistant to master our UPSTrackingNumber challenge, where the assistant helped us to identify the correct business context and propagate the field to the OData API where we needed it to be.
The extensibility assistant supports the following scope:

  • Create Custom Fields: It can create new custom fields in various business contexts.
  • Find Business Contexts: It can help you find the right business context to extend for your custom fields.
  • Find Usages: It can identify where custom fields can be used, such as in UIs, APIs, CDS views, transactions, etc.
  • Enable Usages: It can enable custom fields in identified usages (note that email or form templates are not supported).
  • Find Business Scenarios: It can find business scenarios that involve data flow between different business objects.
  • Find Existing Custom Fields: It can locate existing custom fields in specific business contexts.
  • Find Value Helps: It can find value helps that can be used in custom fields.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

Just like in the Custom Fields Fiori app, you can click “Open Assistant” in the Custom Logic Fiori app, which opens the extensibility assistant (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

You can now enter your query to find an extension point in the text box located under the “Your Question” label. As this assistant helps with finding extension points, it’s recommended to enter a query where you outline what you want your implementation to do. As soon as you have formulated your query, you can press enter or click the send button. After a short wait, you are prompted with extension points that fit your query.

Currently, the assistant doesn’t support code generation but can only be used to find the correct extension point for your use case. If you are unsure of what the assistant can do, you can ask “What can you do?” to get an answer. In the following section, you find an example on when and how to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

Imagine you get a new requirement for your bill of materials that you need to implement. If your new requirement is not met, the bill of materials should not be saved. To find the extension point that lets you insert custom checks, you tell the assistant “I want to validate my BOM before it is saved”. Once entered, the assistant prompts you with multiple extension points that might fit your use case (as you can see in the screenshot below):

Extensibility assistant after entering a query

List of references that contain further information and documentation

To choose the right extension point, you can have a look at the extension point’s documentation or further documents about the shown extension points. You can find that information by clicking the “References” link under the assistant’s response. There, you’ll find a list of links that will open the resource in your browser. If you click on the extension point’s documentation, a popup will open containing said documentation. Additionally, you will find the extension point’s documentation by clicking the link “View Documentation” in the table.

Popup with the extension point’s documentation

Once you’ve chosen the right extension point, you can select it from the list and click on “Create Implementation”. This will direct you to the creation wizard (see screenshot below). There, the extension point will already be selected for you. From there, you can create the implementation just like you would normally. If you can’t create an implementation for the selected extension point because it can only be implemented once, you get a warning that tells you which implementation already exists for the selected extension point.

Extension point table after selection

Warning if the extension point is already implemented

Now, we’ve successfully used the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app. The extensibility assistant in this app supports the following scope:

  • Find BAdIs: I can find the right BAdI for your custom implementation.

It currently does not support code generation.

Please note that the extensibility assistant is only available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition so far. The intention is to also make it available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, but we can’t share any timeline regarding that yet.

Now, you are done! Congratulations!
You successfully used the extensibility assistant to master challenges with key user custom fields and key user custom logic. You have an idea about the scope of the assistant so that you know what it can do for you, and you know what comes next.

Please note that this blog has been elaborated by a team of experts. entry.title: 智领未来：SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云中的 AI 架构与构建模块解析
entry.content:
在日常工作中，客户和合作伙伴经常会问到SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云到底有哪些 AI 功能？

之前也通过文章分别介绍了 SAP Joule、嵌入式 AI、情境处理（Situation Handling）等具体功能。而今天这篇博客，我想从另一个角度聊聊——也就是 ​​SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云中的 AI 架构​​，以及构建起众多 AI 功能的​​核心模块​​，希望能帮助大家更系统地理解这些 AI 能力，以及 SAP 在 AI 功能开发上的重点方向。

SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云版将 AI 深度嵌入核心业务流程中，通过一系列精心设计的 AI 构建模块，将“AI 视作新的用户界面”（AI is the new UI），致力于为用户带来更直观、高效和智能的工作体验。这些功能不仅简化日常操作、自动化复杂任务，还提供前瞻性的智能洞察，成为智慧企业的重要基石。

从应用层面上来看，我们把这些模块归纳的功能分为几大类：

  • 面向用户体验的 AI​​：内置搜索文本生成什么代码生成等增强用户体验的功能。
  • 面向互动的 AI​​：以 Joule 为入口的对话式 AI，查询处理数据等。
  • 面向自动化的 AI​​：系统可自动完成任务，诸如文档处理，AI agent等自主任务完成。
  • 面向洞察和决策的 AI​​：借助机器学习、情框管理引擎，生成式AI能力，预测预估需求、判断延迟付款或识别潜在风险，并为用户提供下一步最佳措施与智能建议，辅助制定更明智的决策。

下面，我会为您带来每一个模块的详细解析：

S/4HANA Public Cloud中的AI构建模块

 

1： User Experience 用户体验 （内嵌式 AI辅助功能)：优化系统交互，实现“AI 即新 UI”的愿景

这些 AI 能力直接嵌入在云 ERP 系统中，它们通过自然语言处理 (NLP)生成摘要和提供筛选等功能，使搜索和处理业务数据更加高效。

核心功能与技术：

  • 智能摘要 (Smart Summarization)：对基于 Fiori Elements 的业务对象进行智能摘要，涵盖 1000 多个应用程序。
  • 简易筛选 (Easy Filter)：允许用户通过自然语言描述所需数据来筛选列表报告，适用于超过 1100 份报告。
  • 企业搜索 (Enterprise Search)：支持用户使用自然语言进行企业搜索。

许可：这些功能均属于免费的基础 AI (Base AI)，无需购买AI Unit，并且在客户接受 SAP AI 条款后，由 SAP 激活：

2： Joule：SAP专属智能副驾： 快速获取信息，简化应用程序导航，直接管理业务数据

Joule 通过直观的对话方式来简化协作用户日常工作。作为云ERP中最重要的AI的模块，Joule支持越来越多的业务对象的查询，管理，目标是支持 80% 以上的最常用的任务和业务流程。另外客户也可以将Joule作为系统交互的入口，开发属于自己的业务技能和文档信息检索。

Joule 支持多种交互模式，使用户能够以自然语言与系统进行互动：

  • 信息型 (Informational)：Joule 提供简洁的帮助内容摘要，有效回答用户的自然语言问题。例如，您可以询问“什么是无费用销售订单？”或“如何配置采购订单的灵活工作流？”。
  • 导航型 (Navigational)：Joule 推荐相关应用程序，并促进无缝导航，帮助用户执行业务流程。SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 500 个导航场景，例如“我在哪个应用程序中可以看到采购订单？”。
  • 事务型 (Transactional)：Joule 提供关于业务对象的深入信息，无需打开相应的应用程序。用户可以直接在对话中查看和操作业务对象，SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 45 个事务场景。例如，您可以直接询问“显示发货方为 Intelli Corp 的销售订单”。它还支持创建洞察卡、检查销售订单状态、续订过期价格和查看情境等功能。
  • 分析型 (Analytical) ：未来，用户将能够提出分析性问题，Joule 将利用 SAP Analytics Cloud 中的 JustAsk 提供分析洞察。

许可： 截止2508中提供的Joule 功能均已包含在基础 AI (Base AI)中，一次开通便可开始免费使用，无需额外购买AI unit。

3： Agents 代理：自动化复杂任务

作为未来发展的重点，代理技术旨在自动化许多曾经需要人工完成的复杂任务。它们不仅仅是能回答问题，更能​​主动规划并执行任务，它们通常是事件驱动和以实现最终任务为目标导向的。

业务示例： 会计应计 (Accounting Accruals) 和国际贸易分类 (Int. Trade Classification)，未来还将包括生产计划员。

目前AI agent还在开发中，您可以关注SAP的产品路线图查看最新的发布时间。

4： Intelligent Insights 智能洞察：提供数据驱动的建议

此构建模块通过生成式AI技术，利用企业的数据资产，提供针对数据的洞察和解析，智能推荐并提供行动建议。

业务示例： 成本中心财务业务洞察 (FBI for Cost Centers) 和集团财务报表财务业务洞察 (FBI for Group Financial Statement)。

许可，智能洞察功能需要购买SAP AI Unit后订阅高级 AI (Premium AI)  功能使用。

5： Document Processing 文档处理：从非结构化数据中提取价值

这个模块专注于从非结构化文档（如 PDF 或 JPG 格式的文件）中提取信息并自动化相关流程。此模块的功能利用SAP BTP中的文档处理服务（SAP Document AI）对于非机构化业务数据进行提取，并进行下一步流程。

核心功能：

  • 销售订单提取 (Sales Order extraction)：能够自动从 PDF 或图像格式的采购订单文件中创建销售订单。这是一个 机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Scope Item 4X9)，无需额外许可证。
  • 质量证书 (Quality certificates)管理：自动化处理传入的质量证书，提取相关信息。通过 SAP Document AI 处理质量证书属于 高级 AI (Premium AI) 功能，需要订购AI unit后开通使用。

6：Intelligent Communication 智能通信：解读交流，自动化流程

旨在从邮件、聊天、电话或文字记录中摘要、分类、提取和验证信息，并自动化相关流程。

业务示例： 争议管理 (Dispute Management)、分类 (Classification)、回归 (Regression) 和聚类/模式识别 (Clustering / pattern recognition)。

7：Machine Learning 机器学习：预测与优化

此构建模块利用企业的数据资产，并对结构化数据应用机器学习算法。

核心功能：

  • 销售绩效预测 (Sales Performance Prediction) 和 预测交付延迟 (Predicted Delivery Delay)。
  • 销售订单自动完成 (Sales Order Auto Completion)：为销售文档中缺失的数据提供建议，加快销售订单和客户退货订单的文档完成。这属于 机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Scope Item 73P)，无需额外许可证。

8：Pro-Active ERP主动式ERP 情境处理：防患于未然

此模块旨在通知业务专家潜在问题，并提出建议和行动，以避免未被发现的业务问题可能造成的严重后果。

核心功能与技术：

  • 情况处理 Situation Handling：自动检测关键业务问题，并通知相关用户。它可以在 SAP Fiori 启动板、电子邮件或 SAP Mobile Start 中提醒用户，并在应用程序中显示情况信息，提供上下文信息以支持知情决策。情境处理已在 SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 中开箱即用，无需额外操作。它还能利用生成式 AI (GenAI) 提供定制的解决方案建议（测试版功能）。

 

通过这些多样化的 AI 构建模块，SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云版不仅提供了强大的智能能力，还在“基础 AI (Base AI)”和“高级 AI (Premium AI)”两种商业化模式下，帮助企业员工更智能、更高效地完成工作，真正实现数字化转型中的“智慧企业”愿景。

entry.title: Understanding Bundles and Scenarios in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Introduction

When starting an implementation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, one of the first setup steps is defining the scope. Two important concepts in this process are bundles and scenarios. These determine which business processes are available in your system.

What is a Bundle?

A bundle is a predefined collection of business scenarios grouped by a specific business focus.

  • Bundles simplify the scoping process by offering ready-made sets of scenarios.

  • They are country/region-specific, meaning their content may differ depending on the selected country or region.

Available Bundles

  • Baseline Accelerator
    ▪ The essential bundle containing the minimum set of finance-related processes required for a functioning system.

  • Enterprise Management
    ▪ A comprehensive bundle for large enterprises.
    ▪ Includes all content of the Baseline Accelerator plus additional processes such as sales, procurement, and manufacturing.

  • Retail
    ▪ Industry-specific bundle for retail.
    ▪ License-dependent.

  • Public Sector Management
    ▪ Focused on managing budgets, revenue, and expenditure for public institutions.
    ▪ Relevant for government, nonprofit, and educational organizations.
    ▪ Cannot be selected together with other bundles.

Note: The Finance-Led and Professional Services bundles are deprecated and remain available only for customers who had selected them earlier.

Requirement: At least one bundle must be selected in the system scope.

What is a Scenario?

A scenario represents predefined content to support a specific business process.

  • Example: Time Recording (1Q4)

  • Each scenario is identified by a unique three-digit ID, making it easy to locate in the system.

  • Scenarios provide flexibility to tailor the system to the exact processes required by the business.

Group Ledger Scenarios

When defining scope for the first time, a group ledger scenario must be chosen. This choice determines how financial reporting and statements are handled.

Two options are available:

  • Accounting and Financial Close – Group Ledger US GAAP (2VA)

  • Accounting and Financial Close – Group Ledger IFRS (1GA)

Caution: This selection is irreversible. Once finalized, group ledger scenarios cannot be added, removed, or changed later.

License-Dependent and Non-Standard Scenarios

Not all scenarios are included by default:

  • License-dependent scenarios
    ▪ Marked with a lock icon.
    ▪ Require a support case to activate (component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV).

  • Non-standard scenarios
    ▪ Marked with a warning icon.
    ▪ Trigger a warning message before being added.
    ▪ If confirmed, the change is logged.

Key Points to Remember

  • Bundles = predefined sets of scenarios (mandatory to select at least one).

  • Scenarios = individual business processes (flexible selection).

  • Group ledger scenario = critical one-time decision (US GAAP or IFRS).

  • Some scenarios require additional licenses or approvals.

By understanding bundles and scenarios, you can scope their SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition solution more efficiently and align the system with their business requirements from the start.

entry.title: Balance Validation accelerating the period closing by Superb validation, automation and analytics
entry.content:
Join us for co-innovation

We would like to invite the public cloud customers joining us for the co-innovation of AI capability AI assisted Balance Validation Rule Creation, and if you are with valid FBA, please feel free to reply me in this blog, and we are looking forward meeting you.

Let's shape the future together. 

Challenge

Organizations often face challenges such as a financial close process that struggles to reach peak performance, characterized by inefficiencies and delayed timelines. Additionally, governance and compliance requirements can become overly burdensome, consuming valuable time with extensive data collection and documentation efforts. Furthermore, there is frequently a lack of transparency and insight across system boundaries, which hampers decision-making and collaboration. Tackling these issues requires a strategic approach that involves process optimization, technology adoption, and fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.

Key capabilities in financial management systems are designed to enhance accuracy, efficiency, and communication.

  • Managing validation rules and groups standardizes these processes, preventing financial misstatements and reducing audit and compliance risks.
  • Automated balance validation tasks accelerate the closing process and minimize manual efforts, freeing up valuable time for strategic activities.
  • Real-time validation analytics provide immediate insights and maintain a comprehensive audit trail, ensuring transparency and accountability.
  • The ability to add comments facilitates smooth communication between subsidiaries and headquarters, ensuring alignment and reducing misunderstandings. Together, these capabilities transform financial operations, driving reliability and efficiency.

Balance Validation plays a critical role in supporting Accounting and Group Reporting, especially when integrated with Advanced Financial Closing processes. This function ensures that all accounts are accurately reconciled and validated, providing a strong foundation for precise financial reporting. By incorporating Balance Validation into the closing cycle, organizations can identify discrepancies early, reduce errors, and enhance the integrity of their financial statements. This integration not only accelerates the closing process but also strengthens group reporting by ensuring consistent and reliable data across all levels of the organization, thereby supporting compliance and informed strategic decision-making.

The application of Manage Balance Validation Rules and Groups provides a centralized platform for defining and managing validation rules that prevent financial misstatements and mitigate compliance risks. 

The application Scheduled Balance Validation Jobs accelerates the financial closing cycle while significantly reducing manual workload by automating balance validation tasks.

entry.title: Workforce Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP´s ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution. SAP S/4HANS Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem – customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

Managing a skilled workforce efficiently is paramount for any growing organization. With the release 2508 of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, businesses are empowered with robust HR connectivity options, which streamline workforce management activities. This article provides guidance on handling workforce data, work agreements, and user management using various technical integration options.

In traditional Identity Management (IDM) scenarios, HR systems usually take the lead in managing worker data and work agreements. Business user data might be managed directly in an IDM system or integrated via an HR system. The culmination of these processes sees the provisioning of worker data, work agreements, and business user data into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant through effective HR and IDM integration. Successful workforce management in this landscape hinges on strategic decisions about data creation through HR or IDM integration, based on which system leads.

 

Results: Realizing Workforce Management Scenarios


Imagine a scenario where SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is integrated with both the SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (using SAP Master Data Integration for HR) and an external IDM system via SOAP-based integration with SAP Cloud Identity Services. Here, aligning IDM integration as the leading choice brings forth several advantages.

 

Define Workforce Management System and Choose an Integration Option

  • IDM Integration Leads: Creating business user and worker data first allows users to access the system and perform tasks without needing pre-established work agreements.
  • HR Integration Leads: Worker data and work agreements are provisioned first, followed by business user creation, ensuring structured data flow.

To configure your scenario, access SAP Central Business Configuration for your specific tenant, locate the Define Workforce Management Scenario (106757) activity, and select your desired option: IDM or HR integration. Be sure to confirm data consistency across systems before switching options.

 

Flexible Data Management

With the integration setup, you can create worker and business user data within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition through the integration with SAP Cloud Identity Services or manually via the Manage Workforce or Maintain Business Users apps. However, once data is created through integration, it cannot be modified directly in these apps. The Entry Source field denotes where data can be edited and its origin. Refer to the Entry Source documentation for further information. If establishing a work agreement through HR integration precedes the creation of a worker record, an error will occur.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition empowers businesses with flexible HR connectivity options for workforce management. By carefully selecting and implementing integration strategies, organizations can achieve efficient operations and seamless data management, essential for navigating the complex terrain of modern business environments. Choose the path that aligns best with your operational needs, ensuring a smooth and effective workforce management experience.

entry.title: Data Migration for Test Environment Validation in 3-system landscape.
entry.content:
Embarking on the 3-System Landscape (SL) journey in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can be overwhelming. A newly provisioned test tenant may not operate efficiently unless it contains sufficient known data to support you best with testing and validations. 

To address this challenge and accelerate test tenant readiness, SAP has introduced two strategic options, namely TEST DATA CONVERSION and TEST DATA REFRESH. These features are designed to accelerate tenant readiness by simplify data handling and thereby enhancing overall system efficiency. 

In this blog, we’ll take a high-level look at the 3-SL and explore how TEST DATA CONVERSION and TEST DATA REFRESH facilitate to a smoother, faster, and reliable test environment setup. 

 

3-SL  

As part of your strategic transformation, you are planning to migrate from a 2-SL to a 3-SL in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This transition is aimed at enhancing system governance, improving testing capabilities, and enabling a clear change management process. Before diving into the data migration services, let’s examine the landscape differences between the current 2-SL setup and the target 3-SL setup to understand the value and impact of this shift.  

 As part of the 3-SL conversion in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a new test tenant is introduced to support robust validation and quality assurance. However, at the time of conversion, this tenant is provisioned as an empty tenant, with no data (transactional or master data) available. To make this test tenant fully functional and efficient, it must be filled with the essential fuel that drives all meaningful testing, which is nothing but valid data. 

As the saying goes, “Data is the new fuel” and without it, even the most advanced SL cannot deliver value to its fullest. Populating the test tenant with relevant, valid, and consistent data is critical to make the test tenant valuable and ensure a smooth transition to production tenants. 

Now that we understand the importance of data in powering the test tenant, the next step is to determine how to introduce this data effectively into test tenants.

 

Manual Data Uploads: A Time-Consuming Process 

While manual data uploads are technically possible using SAP Fiori apps, templates, or others. but they involve significant drawbacks: 

  • High Effort: Manually preparing valid data and uploading data comes at the cost of extensive time and resources.  
  • Cumbersome Process: This process itself will be complex and challenging as multiple tools and formats need to be used and the complexity increases with large data volumes. 
  • Delayed Availability: Test tenant will not be available for business use until the manual data upload is completed, there by blocking the testing activities for the released objects.

We have seen that, manual data entry is not ideal for large volume of data upload and accelerating tenant readiness. 

 

Embracing Automation: Smarter Ways to Populate Your Test Tenant 

We’re in the era of automation and manual data entry is no longer a viable option for efficient system setup. If you already have rich, validated data in your customizing tenant and production tenant, the question becomes: 
How can you use this data to build a clean, depersonalized, and test-ready environment in your new test tenant. To address this common pain point, SAP has introduced two specialized services designed to simplify and accelerate the process: 

  • TEST DATA CONVERSION – post-conversion accelerator 
  • TEST DATA REFRESH – Ongoing quality assurance 

 

To streamline the setup of a new test tenant, SAP offers two powerful services that cater to different data sources and testing needs: 

 TEST DATA CONVERSION Service – post-conversion accelerator 

  • Purpose: Transfers configuration and application data from the Customizing Tenant to the New Test Tenant. 
  • Goal: Ensures the new test system is available seamlessly and without issues, reflecting the latest customizing setup. 
  • Source System: Customizing Tenant 
  • Target System: New Test Tenant 

This service is ideal for scenarios where you want to validate configurations, execute test cases, test new features based on your previous customizing tenant. 

 

 TEST DATA REFRESH Service – Ongoing quality assurance 

  • Purpose: Transfers selected business data from the Production Tenant to the New Test Tenant. 
  • Goal: Ensures the new test system is populated with production-like test data, enabling realistic testing and ongoing quality assurance. 
  • Source System: Production Tenant 
  • Target System: New Test Tenant 

This service is perfect for regression testing, integration validation, and performance benchmarking using real-world data.

 

What’s Next? 

In this blog, we explored the two key services TEST DATA CONVERSION and TEST DATA REFRESH that help populate a new test tenant efficiently. We also clarified the source and target systems for each service along with their roles in test tenant setup. 

In the next blog, we’ll take a deep dive into the TEST DATA CONVERSION service, examining its capabilities, process flow, and how it ensures a seamless transition from the customizing tenant to the test tenant. Stay tuned to uncover configuration tips, and real-world use cases that make TEST DATA CONVERSION a game-changer for test system readiness.
