entry.title: Modifying posting information in the Purchase Order Accruals Process – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
1. Purchase Order Accruals Process Overview

The Purchase Order Accruals tool allows you to automatically calculate and add accruals to the General Ledger.
It works by taking data from the Materials Management area and then changing purchase order items into accrual items using the Accrual Engine. This process calculates how much should be accrued for each purchase order item, and you can even test these calculations before applying them. Each period, you can trigger an accrual run that will post all accruals related to various business activities.

This application supports Parallel Accounting, meaning you can calculate and post accruals across different ledger groups at the same time.
From a technical standpoint, the tool is based on the Accrual Engine, where purchase order items become accrual items. While Purchase Order Accruals handles these items, the Accrual Engine deals with the calculation and posting of accruals.

After a purchase order is made, it gets automatically transferred to the Accrual Engine based on how your settings are configured to manage these postings.
In the Accrual Engine, each purchase order is assigned an accrual object.

 

2. The case for posting data change

In the dynamic world of financial accounting, businesses often encounter scenarios where standard functionalities may not align perfectly with specific regulatory or operational requirements.
Purchase Order Accruals play a critical role in maintaining accurate financial records, especially across various ledgers. However, the diverse nature of global accounting practices, such as differing Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), can necessitate adjustments in how accruals are posted. Businesses might find that certain accrual postings must be customized to comply with local regulations or internal policies. This requires a more flexible approach to modify specific posting data, ensuring precision and adherence to relevant accounting standards.

In the next chapters, we will explore some possibilities in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition when the change of posting data in Purchase Order Accrual postings is required. By understanding these factors, companies can better navigate the potential pitfalls and implement effective solutions that cater to their unique accounting needs.

 

3.  Understanding Accrual Engine Dependencies - Configuration

To begin utilizing the purchase order accrual features, you first need to activate the Purchase Order Accruals application, which involves enabling the appropriate scope item. Depending on your specific needs, you may also need to adjust configuration settings to ensure the functions align with your requirements, like add a review procedure.

There are several configuration options available that allow for personalization of the accrual functionalities. For instance, you can modify settings that determine which purchase order items will have accruals posted, as well as the manner of their posting.

The accrual engine configuration in SAP Public Cloud is company code dependent and not Ledger dependent, meaning you can define different conditions for different company codes. The Accrual Methods available are pre-delivered.

 

4. Exploring the use of BAdi´s to tailor the procedure to different requirements

You add Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) to the functions to fit the procedure to your regulatory or operational requirements.

There are some BAdis available for Accrual processes, namely:

  • BADI_ACE_DOCUMENT_SCHEMA_CLD – Modify Journal Entry Line Items
  • BADI_ACE_ACCHIVING_CHNG_DATE – Change completion date
  • BADI_ACE_ACCHIVING_CHECK – Change result of check
  • BADI_ACE_DOC_FIELDS_MAPPING – ACE document fields mapping
  • FACRA_ADJMT_TOLERANCE_CHECK – Adjustment tolerance check

Particularly relevant for posting modifications is BADI_ACE_DOCUMENT_SCHEMA_CLD, which enables to set below values for journal entry lines:

  •      cost_center (cost center)
  •      profit_center (profit center)
  •      glaccount (G/L account)
  •      item_text (item text of the journal entry item)

 

You can implement custom BAdI logic tailored to your business needs in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition through the Custom Logic App. Find more here.

 

5. Exploring API alternatives to tailor the procedure to different requirements

SAP S/4HANA Cloud provides several APIs for journal entry management that might help in adjusting accrual amounts before posting.

Some key notes on using API for Journal Entry Adjustments:

  • API Journal Entry - Post (Synchronous/Asynchronous): These APIs allow for the posting of journal entries from external systems to your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.
    Find more here.

 

  • API Journal Entry by Ledger - Post (Asynchronous): This API enables uploading multiple journal entry documents with ledger group information.
    Find more here.

entry.title: How to set up Withholding Tax in Treasury Using Extended Withholding Tax
entry.content:
This blog describes setup of the withholding tax using integration from SAP Treasury and Risk Management (treasury) to the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting. Besides the calculation and accounting this integration also ensures that corresponding withholding tax information is added to the resulting accounting documents. Such documents are included in standard legal reports in a given country. There are also other possibilities to calculate and account withholding taxes, e.g. using derived flows, however the resulting documents usually lack all the necessary withholding tax information.

Pre-delivered configuration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enables posting to supplier. However, this example scenario covers withholding tax on incoming interests in money market instruments posted to customer to describe all configuration steps. 

We focus on the configuration and master data related to withholding tax, we expect that you have already completed general setup for treasury and for the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting.

 

1          Customizing Prerequisites

The withholding tax code and tax type are defined in Financial Accounting.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Payment Time, the system generates the withholding tax only at the time of payment in the transaction F110 (Automatic Payment). In this case, treasury generates only an empty flow and a corresponding item for table WITH_ITEM with withholding tax base amount.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Invoice Time, the system generates the withholding tax line item in the accounting document of the interest. Treasury then generates a flow with withholding tax amount.

 

2          Customizing in Treasury

2.1       Define Update Type for Withholding Tax

In our example we use update type TAXWH01.

2.2       Define Account Determination for Interest

The extended withholding tax requires posting to supplier/customer, therefore it is necessary to set up account determination for interest in treasury accordingly.

2.2.1     Posting Specification

It contains document type for posting on customer and GL account. The posting key for debit entry is for customer, and the account symbol has posting category for subledger posting in payment currency.

2.2.2     Assign Update Type to Posting Specification

It is important to mark the indication Payment Transaction in the assignment of the update type to posting specification.

2.3       Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax

In this activity we assign the withholding tax update type to the interest update type.

Note. Only maintain key fields that are relevant for the actual interest flow. If you maintain securities account for interest from money market instrument, the configuration won’t be selected in the processing, because money market instrument doesn’t carry securities account.

If you have a scenario with interest for securities do not maintain transaction type, because interests in securities account management (transaction TPM40) don’t carry transaction type.

The assignment also contains the withholding tax type and withholding tax code.

 

3          Business Partner Master Data

The withholding tax data are maintained in the corresponding tab Customer: Withholding Tax        

Note that the withholding tax and withholding tax code must be same as in the activity Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax. Also, the indicator withholding tax agent must be set.

 

4         Processing of the financial transaction

4.1       Create Financial Transaction

Enter the money market transaction as usual. On payment details page, it is crucial that the interest is posted to customer and without payment request:

 

The generated planned withholding tax isn’t visible directly under the Cash Flow tab. You can check it in the transaction TPM13 Treasury Position Flows – Classic

Note that this is only planned withholding tax. In some cases, the withholding tax can depend on some limits related to the business partner, and so the resulting withholding tax at the time of posting can differ. The cash flow in TPM13 serves as a good indication whether everything is set up correctly and the withholding tax is generated.

4.2       Post financial transaction

The withholding tax is posted together with the interest in the transaction TBB1 (Fix, Pay, and Post Flows). There is a limitation in posting log, which puts withholding tax in two-line items, whereas resulting accounting document has only one line item for withholding tax.

For more information about the basic settings for withholding tax, see Withholding Tax in Treasury.
